The Old School is the New School Again. That's my message of the month for Fogelman students. Memphis employers are telling me they want graduates who know how to communicate, know how to work in teams, know how to learn, and are excited to join an organization in a face-to-face work environment. So get ready to be in the office, write and speak clearly, handwrite your thank you notes, and share your business cards. About 14 years ago I was teaching online courses at Oregon State, and online teaching back then made me kind of unique. No more; every professor now knows how to teach online. Similarly, our grads can no longer differentiate themselves with remote-work skills. The vast majority of our workforce knows how to work remotely, so although we will not neglect this important aspect of modern work, this skill is no longer unique. If you want to be differentiated today, tell your interviewer that you know how to be a great team player, and that you are excited to be engaged face-to-face in their organization. That's what Fogelman students are hearing, and I can see them preparing themselves everyday to be career-ready. Hire our grads!
